Ray Dalio warned at Davos that rising trade tensions, widening deficits & policy uncertainty could erode confidence in U.S. assets triggering what he called ‚Äúcapital wars.‚Äù

He noted growing flows into gold as a hedge against a breaking monetary order arguing investors remain underallocated to hard assets even as debt & geopolitical risks rise.

$PLTR CEO Alex Karp said the real lesson from AI on the battlefield is that advantage comes from doing what no one else can.

Palantir‚Äôs ontology does this by mapping a company‚Äôs data, systems & workflows into a shared language so AI can actually act.
BITCOIN $BTC JUST BROKE BELOW $90K

Blackrock CEO Larry Fink said Davos is an elite gathering trying to shape a world that many affected by its decisions will never attend.

He acknowledged a deep loss of public trust and warned the World Economic Forum must regain legitimacy to remain relevant

$MSFT CEO Nadella says an AI bubble forms if the benefits stay concentrated.

If AI doesn‚Äôt show up as broad productivity gains and real economic growth beyond hyperscalers then it‚Äôs a warning sign we‚Äôre just recycling spend rather then creating value.

Ownership is starting to matter more than access in the AI economy.

The market is clearly rewarding companies that own AI compute like $NVDA & $GOOGL while separating them from those that primarily consume it like $AAPL & $MSFT.

U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the U.S. has been pursuing Greenland for years and that the effort is not new.

He argued the U.S. must take a stronger role because Europe cannot guarantee its own security.

$NOW & OpenAI signed a 3-year partnership to embed OpenAI models & agents directly into ServiceNow workflows with usage-based revenue tied to customers.

The deal includes voice agents for customer service & agent-driven IT actions like restarting machines & pulling data from legacy systems.

Japan‚Äôs bond market is in a full-blown selloff today with yields spiking to their highest level in ~20 years.

Warning that global rates volatility is back.

$UBER CEO says he expects rides to be largely robot-driven over the next 20 years with autonomous drivers ultimately safer than humans as they never tire or stop improving.

Adoption will be gradual but falling costs & L3/L4-ready vehicles point to a trillion-dollar transition.

Goldman Sachs projects TSMC‚Äôs $TSM annual CoWoS capacity to more than triple between 2025 and 2027, from ~675K wafers to 2.31 million wafers, revised up from 1.74 million wafers. 

$NVDA $AMD $AVGO

Inference is projected to be the main driver of this growth, with global demand rising at a 35% CAGR from barely 21 GW to more than 93GW by the end of the decade.

üì∫ VOLATILE DAY AHEAD: HERE‚ÄôS WHAT I‚ÄôM WATCHING

$AAPL has been weak for a while‚Äîbelow short-term moving averages and trading poorly‚Äîbut could be worth watching as a possible ‚Äúsafety trade‚Äù near its 200-day moving average, especially if it puts in an early low.

$GOOGL has been the stronger name structurally, holding key moving averages, but is now testing the 21-day and showing the first signs of relative weakness, raising the question of whether it holds support or plays downside catch-up. 

$TSLA remains the weakest of the three, sitting near its lows of the year and below major averages, with no reason to be involved yet unless it stabilizes at those levels.

The focus today is on staying patient, simplifying decisions on a volatile day, and waiting to see which of these names sets up.
AkademikerPension manages roughly $23‚Äì$25 Billion USD. Even if they dumped 100% of their US Treasury holdings, it would barely register. The US Treasury market trades ~$600+ Billion per day.
Sometimes $aapl likes days like today for cash flow

üì∫ THIS IS ONE OF THOSE MARKET DAYS ‚Äì HERE IS MY PLAN

Get on my insider newsletter list: t3live.com/scott-free-newsle‚Ä¶

This could be one of those rare, highly volatile days where traders must stay flexible and focus on controlling risk rather than reacting emotionally.

Today multiple scenarios are possible‚Äîfrom an early bounce that offers trading opportunities to a breakdown that could start a multi-week downside sequence.

Have multiple plans, define clear levels ($679 on $SPY and recent lows on $QQQ), and look for relative strength in a sea of red.

Trade smaller, manage hedges, and understanding why you‚Äôre in each position as the market decides whether this move is a temporary shock or the start of something bigger.

$SPX futures are -110 handles, trading down near the Jan 2nd lows with 6820ish as key support this morning.. Question is do we make our lows in the first 30‚Äì60‚Äì90 minutes and bounce, or do we get a real trend-down day.
